alert.note: Alert for Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 10:34PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wilson and southern Woodson Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1034 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Yates Center, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Yates Center, Buffalo, Rose, Piqua, Batesville and Toronto Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for southeastern Kansas.
